comments.body: @nikos-github: Please refer to https://github.com/Azure/sonic-buildimage/pull/2335. If you remember, we're now configuring NTP after all Dockers have started due to the fact Supervisor doesn't properly handle the clock rolling backward in between process state changes. We found that there was still a chance that ntp-config gets started while some Dockers were still starting up. This delay is to ensure that all Supervisor processes in all Dockers have finished starting up processes before NTP has a chance to roll the clock backward. This PR and #2335 are interim solutions until we can get a version of Supervisor which uses the monotonic clock.

@jleveque @lguohan 5 mins is a long time to wait for ntp to start. We may as well not start it at all - why bother? :-)

On a serious note, are we getting to a point where we either push supervisord to fix this or we fix it ourselves? Why have the dockers not started within 5 minutes? What if we find out there are cases where it's 10 minutes or 15? Clearly we hit such a case with the 5 minutes interval.

> are we getting to a point where we either push supervisord to fix this or we fix it ourselves?

Yes. I think we are going to have to fix it ourselves.

@nikos-github , the docker started, it is just all the supervisord services in the docker needs time to start. Simply put the ntp after docker start is not enough, so we have to introduce the timer. Since this is a follow-up fix for the previous issue. It is better to have this in as a complete solution (workaround).

latestReviews.body: I hope we have a plan to fix this soon because it's not a good idea to have ntp syncrhonise the clock so late (and we can discuss why offline along with examples). BTW I haven't seen such a delay in the supervisord services inside the docker. Would be nice to know under what scenario this is observed.

reviews.body: What is the problem we are trying to solve here? Can you explain why this change is needed?

I hope we have a plan to fix this soon because it's not a good idea to have ntp syncrhonise the clock so late (and we can discuss why offline along with examples). BTW I haven't seen such a delay in the supervisord services inside the docker. Would be nice to know under what scenario this is observed.

comments.body:
Is it a bug that many lanes are mapping to the same port name?
```
Ethernet80      80                Ethernet21/1      10000      21
Ethernet80      81                Ethernet21/2      10000      22
Ethernet80      82                Ethernet21/3      10000      23
Ethernet80      83                Ethernet21/4      10000      24
Ethernet84      84                Ethernet22/1      10000      25
Ethernet84      85                Ethernet22/2      10000      26
Ethernet84      86                Ethernet22/3      10000      27
Ethernet84      87                Ethernet22/4      10000      28
```

> Is it a bug that many lanes are mapping to the same port name?
> 
> ```
> Ethernet80      80                Ethernet21/1      10000      21
> Ethernet80      81                Ethernet21/2      10000      22
> Ethernet80      82                Ethernet21/3      10000      23
> Ethernet80      83                Ethernet21/4      10000      24
> Ethernet84      84                Ethernet22/1      10000      25
> Ethernet84      85                Ethernet22/2      10000      26
> Ethernet84      86                Ethernet22/3      10000      27
> Ethernet84      87                Ethernet22/4      10000      28
> ```

Yes it was fixed in https://github.com/Azure/sonic-buildimage/pull/2618
can this change apply to 201803 branch?
@lguohan: Yes, this PR will apply cleanly to the 201803 branch. I recommend cherry-picking it.
what overhead are we adding here? could this slow down container stop or start for some time critical task such as warm reboot, fast-reboot?
@lguohan: The overhead should be negligible. Supervisor doesn't write very many log messages. However, we could take measurements with and without the change to be certain.

Broadcom sanity test failure is not related to the change:
```
Cloning into 'isc-dhcp'...
fatal: unable to access 'https://salsa.debian.org/berni/isc-dhcp.git/': Failed to connect to salsa.debian.org port 443: Network is unreachable
Makefile:9: recipe for target '/sonic/target/debs/isc-dhcp-common_4.3.3-6_amd64.deb' failed
```

For 1st. version is a tag of this package. There should be a command in Setuptools package to show the version history.
For 6th. Yes, it should be read only once every field has been set well in chassis_tbl. The question is where to set all the fields. As it is involved from the new platform API, current no logic to cover it. From my point of view, each daemon should set the related fields of chassis_tbl by themselves. 
For 7th. Not sure the other platforms. But on MLNX platform, num_psu will not change during system live. If PSU is taken out, there is a file in Sysfs will indicate the "precense" is "0" of this PSU.

For other comments, such as comments correction, logging, error handling, I think it should be more likely an improvement task for all the daemons in sonic-platform-daemon repo. It is good for improving the robustness of the daemons, but I would suggest covering those items in a separate commit as the purpose of this commit is just to add the PSU daemon.

latestReviews.body:
I am unable to comment on sonic-psud/scripts/psud so i am placing my comments below
sonic-psud/scripts/psud

1.	General question: what is the purpose of version and what happens when version number is changed?
2.	Line #4: please use psud and not Psud
3.	Line #42-44 I believe this is not the first time we have REDIS_XXX definition. Do we have many places for defining it? Why not create a single place? I believe you will need it also for all the rest of the daemons in pmon.
4.	Same comment for log functions. Why they are different from one daemon to another? I believe some input param should to the trick for all daemons in pmon
5.	Line #166 can stat_db be null? Should you verify and place error handling?
6.	Line #171 what is the logic behind chassis_tbl? Should it read only once in system life cycle?
7.	Line #172 can the num_psu changed during the system live? How you handle PSU taken out?
8.	Line #179 Can psu_db_update fails? I see no error handling
9.	Line #186: no need for double Error “log_error("Error: return error from psu daemon, exiting...")”

reviews.body: As comments, plus please update the sonic-platform-daemons submodule in order to incorporate psud into the image.

3.	Line #42-44 I believe this is not the first time we have REDIS_XXX definition. Do we have many places for defining it? Why not create a single place? I believe you will need it also for all the rest of the daemons in pmon.
4.	Same comment for log functions. Why they are different from one daemon to another? I believe some input param should to the trick for all daemons in pmon
